189.86.text:

hands-on savvy, and relentless

275.51.text:
So my story is a story of

281.05.text:
I was born and raised in
Newfoundland, Canada

283.65.text:
dropped out of high school when I was 14,

288.69.text:
tuna, lobster. I headed to the

294.39.text:
Now, this was the height of

297.26.text:

300.53.text:
chasing fewer and fewer fish further

308.64.text:

317.42.text:
producing some of the lowest,
some of the worst,

322.76.text:
for some of the lowest quality,

Those were some of the best

Our farms have small footprints.

We’re going to farm to protect our

So our goal was to take on three

And we reject agriculture’s obsession

they eat them, so by eating like fish,

We can grow huge amounts of crops in

10 to 30 tons of seaweed,

764.13.text:

making it hands down the most

842.88.text:
Because Mother Nature created these

now that our coral reefs,

and really trying to tackle,

968.30.text: to build a bridge between land and sea.

that puts jobs, justice, and restoration

Right? I kill things for a living.

1026.19.text:
So we built GreenWave, which is a hybrid

1031.00.text:
to begin building this industry from

1033.43.text: So we work to replicate and scale.

We don’t franchise. That’s a tool

1046.41.text:

we make things accessible to everybody.

1055.15.text:

to build an agricultural system

1517.75.text: Building an economy of food and work

1520.42.text:
where fishermen like me are proud
to write songs about it.

1524.29.text: We can create something so beautiful,

1526.86.text: so powerful and restorative out at sea.

1530.00.text:
And we can eat together,
we can work together,

1533.20.text:
and just figure out how to make a living
on a living planet.

1535.77.text: Thanks so much, really appreciate it.
